text:
I always seem to hit the following when profiling a bit of code:
```┌ Warning: There were no samples collected. Run your program longer (perhaps by
│ running it multiple times), or adjust the delay between samples with
│ `Profile.init()`.```
even though I have tried both suggestions given in the warning over many different settings. Any pointers?

elements.text: I always seem to hit the following when profiling a bit of code:

┌ Warning: There were no samples collected. Run your program longer (perhaps by
│ running it multiple times), or adjust the delay between samples with
│ `Profile.init()`.
even though I have tried both suggestions given in the warning over many different settings. Any pointers?

text: Unfortunately profiling is broken on macOS, seemingly due to a MacOS issue. Apple know about it and have said they’d look into it, but I don’t know more

elements.text: Unfortunately profiling is broken on macOS, seemingly due to a MacOS issue. Apple know about it and have said they’d look into it, but I don’t know more

text: If you have access to a Linux machine/VM, I recommend using that for profiling

elements.text: If you have access to a Linux machine/VM, I recommend using that for profiling

text: Ah, good to know. Thanks very much for the quick help!
